p: The chemical composition and relative percentages of the contents of A. sinensis alcohol extracts, prepared according to Section 3.2.3, were determined by GC-MS and the results are listed in Table 2. The results show that the volatile components of the blossom (16.59%), seed (21.30%), peel (21.50%), and blade (13.34%) contained a high abundance of fatty acids, such as benzoic acid, and 10-octadecenoic acid methyl ester. Similarly, the alcohol extracts of the blossom (15.96%), seed (36.66%), peel (28.28%), and blade (8.66%) contained n-hexadecanoic acid and squalene. Squalene has strong oxygen capacity, antifatigue, and anticardiovascular disease effects [ 29]. The main chemical constituents in the blade were myristicin and palmitic acid. In a preliminary study by Wu and coworkers [ 13], A. sinensis peel extracts showed obvious antibacterial and antitumor activities. However, the proportion of these compounds in the branches, xylem, bark, and root was very low.
